Package it.unipr.sowide.actosis.util.space

Class Geometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.sowide.actosis.util.space.Geometry
  • public final class Geometry
extends java.lang.Object
    The Geometry class provides a set of methods for performing some 2D geometric operations.

      • position

        public static int position​(DoublePairVector f,
                           DoublePairVector s,
                           DoublePairVector p)
        Computes the relative position of a point respect to a line.
        Parameters:
        f - the first point defining the line.
        s - the second point defining the line.
        p - the point.
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the point is down, on, or up the line.

      • intersection

        public static DoublePairVector intersection​(DoublePairVector a,
                                            DoublePairVector b,
                                            DoublePairVector c,
                                            DoublePairVector d)
        Gets the intersection point between two lines.
        Parameters:
        a - the first point of the first line.
        b - the second point of the first line.
        c - the first point of the second line.
        d - the second point of the second line.
        Returns:
        the intersection point or null if there is not an intersection between the lines.

      • lineSegmentIntersection

        public static DoublePairVector lineSegmentIntersection​(DoublePairVector p,
                                                       DoublePairVector d,
                                                       DoublePairVector b,
                                                       DoublePairVector e)
        Gets the intersection point between two line segments.
        Parameters:
        p - the initial point of the first line segment.
        d - the final point of the first line segment.
        b - the initial point of the second line segment.
        e - the final point of the second line segment.
        Returns:
        the intersection point or null if there is not an intersection between the two line segments.
